intro: Cochlearia lyrata, commonly known as the lyrate cochlearia, is a flowering plant species native to the Arctic and subarctic regions. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with small, four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal areas, thriving in cool, moist environments. Its leaves are usually basal, rosette-like, and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are small and white or pale yellow. Cochlearia lyrata is known for its resilience to harsh climates and is often found in alpine and tundra habitats.
